title: How to Clean a DVD Player

steps.headline: Remove any discs from the DVD player.
steps.description: These will likely get jammed if you forget to remove them.

steps.headline: Unplug the DVD player from the mains and your TV, and remove it from its stand/case etc.
Take a damp cloth and rub it gently across the top, front, and sides of your DVD player.
steps.description: Never wipe down the back of your DVD Player!

steps.headline: If the back or underside of your DVD player is dirty, use a dry cloth to gently rub around all the ports and screws etc.
Reconnect up the DVD player to the mains and TV.
Now play through your 'lens cleaning disc'.
steps.description: This will gently remove any dirt inside the DVD player mechanism. This may take a while.

steps.headline: You're done!
steps.description: You can now enjoy your movies a little bit more by knowing that your DVD player is clean.
